section.title: Disable Graphical Login
section.para:
Disables the graphical login manager by changing the systemâ€™s default run-level from 5 to 3 in /etc/inittab . When the machine is rebooted, a text login will be provided instead of a graphical login.
/etc/inittab
Files and Directories /etc/inittab
inittab
On Linux systems, this module replaces the id:5:initdefault: line with id:3:initdefault: in the /etc/inittab file.

On Solaris systems, this module disables the svc:/application/graphical-login/cde-login:default service.
svc:/application/graphical-login/cde-login:default
Solaris services svc:/application/graphical-login/cde-login:default
If you plan on using the OS Lockdown graphical interface, you can still start the graphical login session with startx command.
